document.docAuthor: Cruz-Rodríguez, Cristian, Lynch, John D., Cárdenas, Julieth S. & Caicedo-Portilla, José Rancés
document.masterDocTitle: Type specimens housed in the herpetological collections at Museo de La Salle Bogotá and their historical importance for the consolidation of herpetology in Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Type specimens housed in the herpetological collections at Museo de La Salle Bogotá and their historical importance for the consolidation of herpetology in Colombia

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Museo de La Salle, Universidad de La Salle. Carrera 2 # 10 - 70. & Grupo de Investigación en Biotecnología y Medio Ambiente, Universidad Incca de Colombia. Carrera 13 No. 24 - 15, Bogotá Colombia.
Instituto de Ciencias Naturales, Universidad Nacional de Colombia. Cra. 30 # 45 - 03, edificio 425, Bogotá, Colombia. johndouglaslynch @ gmail. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 6358 - 1610
Museo de La Salle, Universidad de La Salle. Carrera 2 # 10 - 70.
Instituto Amazónico de Investigaciones Científicas SINCHI. Avenida Vásquez Cobo entre calles 15 y 16, Leticia, Amazonas, Colombia.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Atractus arangoi
Prado 1939
.
Holotype
ILS 136 (= actual acronym MLS) ( fig. 30 ). “ Colombia .” R.
P. Miguel de Ipiales
,
Jan. 1937
.

Remarks : Adult. Junior synonym of
A. major
according to Schargel et al. (2013) . The locality on the label is “Mocoa, Putumayo ” ( Colombia ), but this is erroneous. Prado (1939) assigned the locality to Colombia when described the species, and laterDaniel (1949) added that it was collected in Puerto Asís, Putumayo ( Schargel et al. 2013 ) and not in Mocoa. Specimen MLS 136 is hydrated and in good state of preservation.

Atractus avernus
Passos, Chiesse, Torres-Carvajal and Savage, 2009
female.
Holotype
MLS 2725 ( fig. 31 ), female. “Paraiso ( 1º14´N , 75º37´W , ca.
480 m
), municipality of Florencia, Department of Caquetá , Colombia .” Brother Nicéforo María ,
Mar. 1951
.
Remarks : Specimen MLS 2725 is hydrated and in good state of preservation.

Atractus biseriatus
Prado, 1940a
. Type locality: “Manizales, Colombia .”
Holotype
ILS 187 (= actual number MLS 145 ) ( fig. 32 ), female. Villamaría , Caldas , Colombia .
Jan. 1938
Remarks : Specimen MLS 145 is hydrated and in good state of preservation.

Atractus colombianus
Prado 1939
.
Holotype
ILS 174 (=actual acronym MLS) ( fig. 33 ), male.
paratype
ILS 155 (= actual acronym MLS) ( fig. 34 ), male. “Chocontá”, Cundinamarca , Colombia .
Jan. 1939
.

Remarks: Currently considered as a junior synonym of
A. crassicaudatus
by Passos and Lynch (2010) . The two specimens are collected in Choconta “Tilata”, Cundinamarca , Colombia . Specimen MLS 174 is hydrated, presents a slight decay but is in good state of preservation. MLS 155 is hydrated and in good state of preservation.

Atractus indistinctus
Prado, 1940b
.
Holotype
ILS 166 (= actual acronym MLS) ( fig. 35 ), female. “Ocaña, departamento Norte de Santander ”, Colombia . Antonio Hernández Yaruro , 1938.
Remarks: Specimen MLS 166 is hydrated and in good state of preservation but badly mounted.

Atractus longimaculatus
Prado 1939
.
Holotype
ILS 170 (= actual acronym MLS) ( fig. 36 ), male. “ Região do Quindio ”.
Jan. 1923
.

Remarks: Junior synonym of
A. crassicaudatus
according to Passos and Lynch (2010) .According to the original label, the specimen was collected in Pacho, Cundinamarca and not in Quindío as indicated the original publication. Specimen MLS 170 is hydrated, presents a slight deterioration but is in good state of preservation.

Atractus manizalesensis
Prado, 1939
.
Holotype
ILS 172 (= actual number MLS 227 ) ( fig. 37 ), male,
paratype
ILS 157 (= actual number MLS 228 ). “Villamaría, Manizales “, Caldas , Colombia .

Remarks : The holotype is an adult and was collected in 1935, without collector indicated. The paratype is a juvenile and was collected by Nestor Díaz in May 1936 . MLS 227 is a hydrated specimen in good state of preservation but badly mounted and MLS 228 is hydrated albeit soft.

Atractus nigriventris
Amaral, 1932
.
Holotype
ILS 82 (= actual number MLS 234 ) ( fig. 38 ), female. “Chita”, Boyacá , Colombia .
May 1932
.

Remarks: The specimen is housed at MLS collections, although the original description mentions its repository as the Butantan Institute. Specimen MLS 234 is hydrated, presents a slight deterioration and badly mounted.

Atractus punctiventris
Amaral, 1932
.
Holotype
ILS 102 (= actual number MLS 254 ) ( fig. 39 ), male.“ Procedente de Villavicencio ”. Brother Nicéforo María.
Jan. 1937
.

Remarks: The original description mentions its repository as the Butantan Institute; however, it is housed in MLS ( Passos et al. 2016 ). Specimen MLS 254 is hydrated and in good state of preservation.

Atractus titanicus
Passos, Arredondo, Fernandes and Lynch 2009
.
Paratypes
134 ( fig. 40 ), male, 146 ( fig. 41 ), female. “ Antioquia department , Sonsón municipality”. MLS 147 ( fig. 42 ). “ Caldas department , Villamaría municality, 05°03´N , 75°31´W , ca.
1850 m
”,
Oct. 1943
.

FIGURE 43. Holotype of
Atractus trivittatus , MLS
258, dorsal and ventral view (Scale bar = 1 cm).

FIGURE 44. Holotype of
Atractus variegatus , MLS
260, dorsal and ventral view (Scale bar = 1 cm).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks: The specimen MLS 134 was collected in Jul. 1923 . MLS 147 was collected in Villa María ( Caldas , Colombia ) in Oct.-1943. MLS 146 was collected in 1938 in the same place that MLS 147, and not in the same place that No. 134 as indicated by Passos et al. (2009). MLS 134 is hydrated specimen in good state of preservation but badly mounted and specimen MLS 146 is hydrated and in good state of preservation.

Atractus trivittatus
Amaral, 1932
.
Holotype
ILS 84 (= actual number MLS 258 ) ( fig. 43 ), male. “Chita”, Boyacá , Colombia .
May 1932
.
Remarks: The original description mentions its repository as the Butantan Institute; however, it is housed in MLS (Passos and Arredondo 2009). Specimen MLS 258 is hydrated but soft.

Atractus variegatus
Prado, 1942
.
Holotype
ILS 201 (= actual number MLS 260 ) ( fig. 44 ), male. “La Uvita, departamento de Boyacá ”, Colombia . Brother Nicéforo María,
Oct. 1940
.
Remarks: Specimen MLS 260 is hydrated, presents slight decay and is badly mounted.

Atractus vertebrolineatus
Prado, 1940a
.
Holotype
ILS 184 (= actual acronym MLS) ( fig. 45 ), male. “Ocaña, al norte de Bucaramanga, [ Santander ,] Colombia .” Antonio Hernández Yaruro,
Dec. 1939
.
Remarks: The original label “ Santander ” appears as a department, but the correct locality is “Ocaña, Norte de Santander , Colombia ”. Specimen MLS 184 is hydrated and presents slight decay.

Atractus wagleri
Prado, 1945
.
Holotype
MLS 228 ( fig. 46 ), female. “ Humbo ( Boyacá ), Colombia ”.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 45. Holotype of
Atractus vertebrolineatus , MLS
184, dorsal and ventral view (Scale bar = 1 cm).

FIGURE 46. Holotype of
Atractus wagleri , MLS
228, dorsal and ventral view (Scale bar = 1 cm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks : This specimen is probably lost. Humbo is a police inspection of the municipality of Quípama, Boyacá ( IGAC 1996 ). Passos and Arredondo (2009) give the approximate coordinates for this locality ( 05°36´N , 74°16´W ) 1000 meters elevation. However, this number is tagged to another specimen,
A. manizalensis ( Prado 1939 )
. Specimen MLS 228 is hydrated and in good state of preservation.

Diaphorolepis lasallei ( Nicéforo María, 1950)
.
Holotype
MLS 357 ( fig. 47 ), male. “Paraje situado al Norte de Albán , Cundinamarca , Cordillera oriental (vertiente Occidental), aproximadamente a 60 kilómetros al noroeste de Bogotá .”. Approximately 2200 meters elevation. Brother Nicéforo María,
Jun. 1947
.
Remarks : Specimen MLS 357 is hydrated, presents a slight deterioration.

Dipsas niceforoi Prado 1940
.
Holotype
MLS 165 ( fig. 48 ), female. “ Quindío , na Cordillera Central , Colombia ”.
Jan. 1940
.

Remarks: Synonym of
Dipsas pratti
according to Peters (1960) . The locality of the publication and in the original label appears “La Salina (B[oyacá])”. Actually, the correct locality is “La Salina, Casanare , Colombia ”. The skull was separated from the specimen. Specimen MLS 165 is hydrated but specimen is inconsistent.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Leimadophis bimaculatus lamonae (
Dunn 1944 c )
.
Holotype
ILS (= actual number MLS 523 ) ( fig. 49 ), male. “ Sonsón , Antioquia , Colombia .
2410 m
).
Jul. 1923
.
Remarks: Specimen MLS 523 is hydrated, presents a slight deterioration and badly mounted.

Oxyrhopus vanidicus Lynch, 2009
.
Paratypes
MLS 1225-26 ( figs. 50 and 51 ), females. “ Departamento de Amazonas , Leticia, casco urbano”, Brother Eduardo Camilo ;
Nov. 1959
.
MLS 1357 ( fig. 52 ), male. “ Departamento de Amazonas , Leticia, casco urbano”, Brother Nicéforo María ;
Mar. 1957
.
MLS 1395 ( fig. 53 ), male. “ Departamento de Amazonas , Leticia, casco urbano”, Brother Eduardo Camilo ,
September 1959
.
Remarks: Specimen MLS 1225 is hydrated, good state of preservation but badly mounted, MLS 1226 is hydrated and in good state of preservation, MLS 1357 and 1395 are hydrated but badly mounted.

Rhadinaea antioquiensis
Dunn 1943b
.
Holotype
ILS 386 (= actual acronym MLS) ( fig. 54 ), female. “San Pedro, Antioquia , Colombia , alt
2560 m
.” 1943
Remarks : With maxilla separated (Noted in the label). Specimen MLS 386 is hydrated, presents a slight deterioration and is badly mounted.

Synophis niceforomariae
Pyron, Arteaga, Echevarría and Torres-Carvajal, 2016
.
Paratype
MLS 2072 ( fig. 55 ), male. “Municipio Campamento, Departamento Antioquia , Colombia . (N 6.979498, W-75.296602;
1656m
”. José María Ortiz ;
Feb. 1970
.
Remarks : Specimen MLS 2072 is hydrated and in good state of preservation but badly mounted.
